head.title: Treasury to Auction Bills During Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury to Auction Bills During Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of new three-
At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.01 percent, and the rate on the six-month issue was 5.99 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of new three-
At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.01 percent, and the rate on the six-month issue was 5.99 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
NSTAR, $200 million of a reopening of 8% securities due in 2010. A2/BBB+/---. Goldman, Sachs.
Source: MCM CorporateWatch Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Duval County, Fla., School District, $53 million of certificates of participation. Merrill Lynch.
Illinois College Savers, $80 million of general obligation bonds. PaineWebber.
Industrial Development Board of Chattanooga, Tenn., $129 million of lease rental revenue bonds. Lehman Brothers.
New Jersey Transit, $600 million of certificates of participation. Merrill Lynch.
New York State Dormitory Authority for Mental Health, $141 million of revenue bonds. J. P. Morgan Securities.
Portland, Ore., $60 million of revenue bonds for the Urban Renewal Downtown Waterfront Project. Salomon Smith Barney.
